data.description:
VRFS is a community-driven soccer (football) simulator with focus on realistic physics and competitive multiplayer.

Here are the main features of VRFS:

PHYSICS SIMULATION: Players can perform almost any trick, from balancing the ball on the tip of their foot to executing curved power shots and long passes. The ball's trajectory is solely determined by the physics engine.

COMPETITIVE MULTIPLAYER: The multiplayer architecture allows for instantaneous ball-touch response. For example, players can finish powerful crosses at the same speed as in real soccer. 

COMFORT: Players can move around using thumbsticks and play in either a seated or standing position. No intense hand movements are required.

NO PAY-TO-WIN in VRFS: Only skills matter. No one can buy 'stronger kicks' or 'faster boots.' Keep practicing, and you'll see improvement.

FREE FOR ALL: Players have full access to the game without needing to purchase anything. However, if you wish, you can buy cool equipment in the store to support the further development of this project.

Please keep in mind that VRFS is still in development, with upcoming upgrades to the physics and scenery. We'd appreciate your suggestions for any enhancements.

UPDATE 0.3.3

Camera mode in private lobbies (beta)
(see the camera icon at the top of the in-game menu)

New pitch material on all arenas

Emoji reactions (beta)
(activate in the settings)

Transparent walls, stadium roofs, and other new objects in the arena editor

Rulers on the floor in arena editor mode

Fixed known bugs in the rulesets (e.g., corners sometimes not triggering)

No more glitchy bouncing of the ball when spawned after a goal or placed in the corner

Significant optimization in all scenes

Refurbished look for default ball skins

Potential fixes for game launch issues and faster loading

Other minor fixes and enhancements

New items in the store, including the 'Hardcore' ball, which is harder to shoot and curl, probably more realistic, and will evolve in future updates

More features are in testing and will be released very soon. 
Thanks for staying tuned!

UPDATE 20.5 

— New objects in custom arenas, including ball cannons and bot goalies, are now available. Some objects feature settings such as block color or ball cannon power. — Bug fixes. Enhanced transitions between lobbies.

UPDATE 20.3

[ CUSTOM ARENAS ]
Arena Info now displays in the menu within a custom arena lobby, showing the arena creator, rating, options to add to favorites, rate, and report the arena.
A new 'Custom Arenas' menu section is introduced for accessing your arenas, favorites, and a 'Featured Arenas' tab for exploring all publicly available arenas.
Arena creator has to host at least one public lobby in order to have that arena be eligible for the ‘Featured’ list.

[ FIXES ]
Resolved an issue preventing more than 16 players from joining custom arena private lobbies. Fixed a bug where jerseys sometimes failed to load. Overall performance optimizations. Fixed minor issues related to ball physics and potentially resolved controller problems.
